plentry.pd: Original sound, disables voice effects.
KTV.
Concert.
Studio.
Phonograph.
Virtual stereo, where the SDK renders mono audio into stereo effect.
Spacious.
Ethereal.

Virtual surround sound, where the SDK generates a simulated surround sound field based on stereo to create a surround effect. To hear the expected effect, users must use audio playback devices that support stereo when virtual surround sound is enabled.
Chorus. Recommended by Agora for chorus scenarios to enhance vocal spatiality.

3D voice, where the SDK renders audio to surround the user. The default surround cycle is 10 seconds. After setting this effect, you can also call to modify the surround cycle. To hear the expected effect, users must use audio playback devices that support stereo when 3D voice is enabled.
Deep male voice. Recommended for processing male voices; otherwise, the effect may not be as expected.
Elderly male. Recommended for processing male voices; otherwise, the effect may not be as expected.
Boy. Recommended for processing male voices; otherwise, the effect may not be as expected.
Young woman. Recommended for processing female voices; otherwise, the effect may not be as expected.
Girl. Recommended for processing female voices; otherwise, the effect may not be as expected.
Pig King.
Hulk.
R&B.
Pop.
Auto-tune, where the SDK corrects the actual pitch based on a natural major scale with C as the tonic. After setting this effect, you can also call to adjust the base scale and tonic pitch.
Original sound, i.e., disables voice effects.
KTV.
Concert.
Studio.
Phonograph.
Virtual stereo, where the SDK renders mono audio into stereo effect.
Spacious.
Ethereal.

Virtual surround sound, where the SDK simulates a surround sound field based on stereo to create a surround effect. To hear the expected effect after enabling virtual surround sound, users need to use audio playback devices that support stereo.
Chorus. Agora recommends using this in chorus scenarios to enhance the spatial stereo effect of vocals.

3D voice, where the SDK renders audio to surround the user. The default surround cycle is 10 seconds. After setting this effect, you can also call to modify the surround cycle. To hear the expected effect after enabling 3D voice, users need to use audio playback devices that support stereo.
Uncle. Recommended for processing male voices; otherwise, the effect may not meet expectations.
Elderly male. Recommended for processing male voices; otherwise, the effect may not meet expectations.
Boy. Recommended for processing male voices; otherwise, the effect may not meet expectations.
Young woman. Recommended for processing female voices; otherwise, the effect may not meet expectations.
Girl. Recommended for processing female voices; otherwise, the effect may not meet expectations.
Pigsy.
Hulk.
R&B.
Pop.

Electronic music, where the SDK corrects the actual pitch of the audio based on the natural major scale with C as the tonic. After setting this effect, you can also call to adjust the base scale and tonic pitch.
Original sound, i.e., disables voice effects.
KTV.
Concert.
Studio.
Phonograph.
Virtual stereo, where the SDK renders mono audio into stereo sound.
Spacious.
Ethereal.

Virtual surround sound, where the SDK simulates surround sound based on stereo channels to create an immersive effect. To experience the expected effect of virtual surround sound, users need to use audio playback devices that support stereo.
Chorus. Agora recommends using this in chorus scenarios to make vocals sound more spatial and three-dimensional.

3D voice, where the SDK renders audio to surround the user. The surround cycle defaults to 10 seconds. After setting this effect, you can also call to modify the surround cycle. To experience the expected effect of 3D voice, users need to use audio playback devices that support stereo.
Deep male voice. Recommended for processing male voices; otherwise, the effect may not be as expected.
Elderly male. Recommended for processing male voices; otherwise, the effect may not be as expected.
Boy. Recommended for processing male voices; otherwise, the effect may not be as expected.
Young woman. Recommended for processing female voices; otherwise, the effect may not be as expected.
Girl. Recommended for processing female voices; otherwise, the effect may not be as expected.
Pigsy.
Hulk.
R&B.
Pop.
Electronic voice, where the SDK corrects the pitch based on the natural major scale with C as the tonic. After setting this effect, you can also call to adjust the base scale and tonic pitch.
Original sound, disables voice effects.
KTV.
Concert.
Studio.
Phonograph.
Virtual stereo, where the SDK renders mono audio into stereo effects.
Spacious.
Ethereal.

Virtual surround sound, where the SDK simulates a surround sound field based on stereo audio to create a surround effect. To hear the expected effect when virtual surround sound is enabled, users must use audio playback devices that support stereo.
Chorus. Agora recommends using this in chorus scenarios to make vocals sound more spatial and three-dimensional.

3D voice, where the SDK renders audio to surround the user. The default surround cycle is 10 seconds. After setting this effect, you can also call to modify the surround cycle. To hear the expected effect when 3D voice is enabled, users must use audio playback devices that support stereo.
Deep male voice. Recommended for male voice processing; otherwise, the expected effect may not be achieved.
Elderly male. Recommended for male voice processing; otherwise, the expected effect may not be achieved.
Boy. Recommended for male voice processing; otherwise, the expected effect may not be achieved.
Young woman. Recommended for female voice processing; otherwise, the expected effect may not be achieved.
Girl. Recommended for female voice processing; otherwise, the expected effect may not be achieved.
Pig King.
Hulk.
R&B.
Pop.
Auto-tune, where the SDK corrects the actual pitch based on the C major scale. After setting this effect, you can also call to adjust the base scale and tonic pitch.
